title.narrative: OPT 3.2. ACCESS TO A CHILD FRIENDLY JUSTICE & CP SERVICES

description.narrative: Children and adolescents in four departments (La Paz, Santa Cruz, Cochabamba and Pando) and selected municipalities with UNICEF support have increased access to a child friendly justice system and specialized child protection services aligned with the national legal framework., which contributes to Access To Justice, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, children and adolescents victims of violence, abuse, neglect and exploitation are protected by functioning systems, policies and a national legal frameork aligned with international standards, including in emergency situations.

related-activity.ref: 0510/A0/05/403 OCM 3. EVERY CHILD IS PROTECTED FROM VIOLENCE AND EXPLOITATION

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Children and adolescents in four departments (La Paz, Santa Cruz, Cochabamba and Pando) and selected municipalities with UNICEF support have increased access to a child friendly justice system and specialized child protection services aligned with the national legal framework.

description.narrative: In 2019, UNICEF and its partners directly reached 3,442 children and adolescents and 144 families with better services. This was done through the training of 1,443 professionals and services providers on related subjects. Intersectoral coordination for children living with imprisoned fathers resulted in 143 children and their families receiving support (legal advice, psychosocial counseling, livelihoods support) and enabled the development of a protocol to protect children with imprisoned parents. This coordination also enabled the promotion of a departmental law to certify care centers and promoted the training of caregivers and other professionals | Status:On-track | As-of Date:20/12/2019

title.narrative: # boys, girls and adolescents whose right to live with their family has been restored

baseline.value: Infrmation NA in two departaments of interventions: La Paz y Cochabamba

title.narrative: # of boys, girls and adolescents who are victims of sexual violence who have received therapeutic services

baseline.value: National 1283 (2016), La Paz 83, Santa Cruz 655, Pando 16, Cochabamba 0

target.value: 2022:National 4500: La Paz 1200, Santa Cruz 1200, Cochabamba 1000, Pando 300

title.narrative: # of adolescents in conflict with the law who benefit from alternative measures

baseline.value: National 452, La Paz 22, Santa Cruz 180, Cochabamba 250

title.narrative: % of boys, girls and adolescents who are victims of sexual violence who have been interviewed in a room with one-way mirror (Gesell chamber).

target.value: 2022:50% in the four departaments of intervention: La Paz 50%, Santa Cruz 50%, Cochabamba 50%, Pando 50%
